meanings.definition: To send back or transfer goods to a different destination.
meanings.sent1: I need to reconsign this package to the correct address.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to reconsign the shipment to a closer warehouse.
meanings.sent3: After realizing the mistake, they had to reconsign the package on a new journey.
meanings.sent4: She reconsigned the parcel, redirecting it like a captain changing course.
meanings.sent5: The act of reconsigning the goods saved the day, ensuring timely delivery.

meanings.definition: To assign or transfer something to a new person or place.
meanings.sent1: Please reconsign the task to someone else who can handle it.
meanings.sent2: The professor had to reconsign the project to a different group.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, they reconsigned the responsibility to the youngest team member.
meanings.sent4: The decision to reconsign the leadership role sparked new energy in the team.
meanings.sent5: He reconsigned the duty with care, ensuring a smooth transition for all involved.
